description.p: Spellmarks and spellscars are commonly regarded as curses or arcane infections, but they can confer beneficial effects and abilities onto their bearers.
Such properties may be selected by or bestowed upon their bearers, but each scar or mark may only be so diverse. The ones created by Gui-Ji have limited potential.
Magical Strikes. While scarred, your weapon strikes are considered magical, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with melee strikes.

Blue-Flame Strike. When you make a melee attack (whether for the Attack action, Attack of Opportunity or similar), you can expend one Hit Dice to replace it with a spellfire-empowered strike. The target must make a DEX saving throw. They suffer the attackâ€™s normal effects and take additional force damage equal to your Hit Dice on a failure, or only the force damage on a success. The DC of the save is equal to 8 + the bonuses you would have had to the attack. So long as the target takes damage from this attack, it counts as having hit.

Bolster, minor. Whenever you roll a skill check, you may expend a Hit Dice as a free action to grant yourself expertise in a skill you are aready proficient in for a number of seconds equal to the number rolled (with a minimum of 1 round).

Withered. All your hit dice are one size smaller. Maximum hit points lost in this way are also deducted from your current hit points. The reduction is determined by the difference of the die sizes' average rolls.

Deeply Etched. The spellmark or spellscar gains the potential to house one additional property, including this one. The source of a spellmark or spellscar loses the ability to be unattuned at-will without magical nullification.
